title: I can't uninstall League
body: I have no idea what happened, but some sort of royal file fuck up has happened with both the legacy and alpha clients, so I wanted to do a clean reinstall to try to fix things.  I was able to uninstall the alpha client, but now I can't uninstall the actual game.  When I try, a message pops up saying "the feature you are trying to use is on a network resource that is unavailable" and it can't find the installation package "LoL.NA.msi".  I've tried using the Hextech Repair Tool and uninstalling manually through the Control Panel; both give me that message.  I always install programs to their default file locations, so I have no clue what's going on.  Anybody know how to fix this?

replies.body:
Hmm, we may have to end up escalating this to one of our tech specialists, but I'd like you to try using [Revo Uninstaller](http://www.revouninstaller.com/revo_uninstaller_free_download.html) or [Wise Uninstaller](http://www.wisecleaner.com/wise-program-uninstaller.html) to try a different approach for the uninstall. 

Let me know if this worked.

Well, perhaps I spoke too soon. I finally got it uninstalled, now reinstalling is the problem. I get a message saying "the older version of League of Legends cannot be removed. Contact your technical support group". Do you know what I should do next?

That's not good! D:

I recommend running a set of system logs using our [HRT App](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367), then attaching them to a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so one of our tech specialists can assist you from here.
Wise Uninstaller seems to have done the trick, thanks!
